{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3646057,"name":null,"username":"AutumnPlanet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/autumnplanet/{size}/260647_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-04T21:50:05.265Z","cooked":"

Hi everyon

For the CAN bus wiring on our robot, are we required to use wires that are specifically labeled as ‚ÄúCAN‚Äù wire (the kind sold as CAN wire with a twisted yellow and green pair)? Or is it acceptable to use regular 22 AWG yellow and green wires, as long as they‚Äôre twisted together properly and meet the general requirements?

We‚Äôre trying to make use of what we already have in the shop and avoid unnecessary purchases if possible. The wire we‚Äôre considering is 22 AWG stranded, flexible, and we can twist it ourselves to reduce noise. Just wondering if this would cause any issues or violate any best practices or FRC rules.

Appreciate any advice or shared experience on this!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-04T21:50:05.265Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":510,"readers_count":509,"score":232.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70504,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646061,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-04T21:59:58.411Z","cooked":"

See R622 and R624.

You don‚Äôt have to use any specifically labeled ‚ÄúCAN‚Äù wire, nor do you even have to use yellow and green wire at all.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-04T21:59:58.411Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":501,"readers_count":500,"score":265.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R622","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R622 | FRCTools","clicks":18},{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R624","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R624 | FRCTools","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646062,"name":"Mert Ata BABER","username":"BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-04T22:13:27.864Z","cooked":"

One thing I can say is that since you are located in Turkey, please do not use Marxl*w brand wires. It was the only brand we could find localy but it came out very low quality. We made this mistake with our CAN wires, and it cost us big time during the competition.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-04T22:15:00.620Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":486,"readers_count":485,"score":162.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"Mert Ata BABER","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646108,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-04T23:45:04.433Z","cooked":"
SWYFT Robotics

SWYFT CANnect Wiring System

Simplify Your Robot Wiring with the SWYFT CANnect Wiring System! Tired of complex robot wiring? SWYFT CANnect revolutionizes your setup by allowing you to run CAN bus and 12V Power over standard Ethernet cables. This drastically reduces wiring...

Price: USD 39.99

No. And there is even product that allow you to use ethernet cable.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-04T23:45:04.433Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":418,"readers_count":417,"score":128.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://swyftrobotics.com/products/swyft-cannect-wiring-system","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SWYFT CANnect Wiring System ‚Äì SWYFT Robotics","clicks":48}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646131,"name":"Mansour Mohamed","username":"Randomperson1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/8c91f0/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-04T23:59:22.091Z","cooked":"

Nope, our team uses our own CAN that we twist from 22AWG wire with unique colors for our two CAN loop. You can just use a drill and a clamp to twist it pretty easily there‚Äôs a YouTube video demonstrating it.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-04T23:59:22.091Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":367,"readers_count":366,"score":103.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"Mansour Mohamed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtu.be/aMUFZZZR7d0?si=iYKe8dnnUy_62ZYL","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66401,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646224,"name":"","username":"mineable3","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mineable3/{size}/231504_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-05T01:02:45.423Z","cooked":"

I got really desperate last year and used PWM cables for extensions in our CAN bus and just didn‚Äôt use the middle wire. Don‚Äôt do that (all of our inspectors yelled at us about it cuz it‚Äôs technically not legal), but it all worked. As long as the colors are consistent and the gauge is right, it‚Äôs a legal CAN bus.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-05T01:02:45.423Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":342,"readers_count":341,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66516,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/6","reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646240,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-05T01:21:37.242Z","cooked":"
mineable3:

Don‚Äôt do that (all of our inspectors yelled at us about it cuz it‚Äôs technically not legal), but it all worked. As long as the colors are consistent and the gauge is right, it‚Äôs a legal CAN bus.

I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs any rule preventing the use of any signal level wiring for any particular signal. Also, the rules don‚Äôt specify any particular color for signal level wiring. It doesn‚Äôt even have to be copper like other wires. As long as it‚Äôs at least 28 AWG you‚Äôre good. If the inspectors knew about it and it wasn‚Äôt legal they wouldn‚Äôt let you compete with it.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-05T01:21:37.242Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":317,"readers_count":316,"score":203.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/7","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646267,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-05T02:57:39.877Z","cooked":"
sokoloff:

nor do you even have to use yellow and green wire

This is absolutely true, but just because you can doesn‚Äôt mean you should.

Having once had the experience of debugging CAN reliability issues on a robot that used a mix of yellow-green and red-black for its CAN bus‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs just say I would rather not do that again. At the very least, if you do it, choose colors different than you use for power, and interconnect the colors consistently to yellow/green at devices.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-05T02:57:39.877Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":270,"readers_count":269,"score":159.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"Brett B Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48574,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646392,"name":"","username":"mineable3","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mineable3/{size}/231504_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-05T13:27:24.674Z","cooked":"

When I say I used PWM as ‚Äúextensions‚Äù I mean that some of the wires were yellow and green and others were black and white. You‚Äôre definitely right that the color doesn‚Äôt matter, but it has to be a consistent color scheme. The issue the inspectors had was with the CAN bus wires constantly switching between two different color schemes.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-05T13:27:24.674Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":43.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64857,"username":"pigrammer","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66516,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646402,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-05T13:40:21.125Z","cooked":"

That‚Äôs not a good idea, but it‚Äôs still legal per the game manual. The only restriction on wire color is R624 which explicitly excludes signal level wiring.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-05T13:40:21.125Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":145.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":66516,"username":"mineable3","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mineable3/{size}/231504_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646409,"name":"Tim Swartz ","username":"VR9450","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/b4bc9f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-05T13:58:22.971Z","cooked":"

The big disadvantage of not using a standard like green and yellow is when other people help trouble shoot they are going to have a harder time helping you. A CSA will still help you but it may take twice as long to solve the problem.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-06-05T13:58:22.971Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":78.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502818,"topic_slug":"do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus","display_username":"Tim Swartz ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66602,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/do-we-have-to-use-official-can-labeled-wire-for-the-can-bus/502818/11","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3646439,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-05T14:29:00.836Z","cooked":"

We‚Äôve started twisting our own wires recently as we were able to get some good quality wire donated. A drill and a vise works pretty well for twisting, just do large sections at a time and twist a little further than you think you need as it will spring back a little.

bbonner:

twisting the wires is hard on them, braiding is preferred.

That‚Äôs good to know! Yeah, believe me, it was not fun to try and debug anything on that robot.

Given multiple mentions of twisting with a drill, you might want to see discussion in this thread, particularly towards the bottom, about braid vs. twist. TL;DR: twisting the wires is hard on them, braiding is preferred.

The nastiest CAN failure we‚Äôve had on a robot was due to a wire with an internal break mid-run that went intermittent and quickly failed completely. That was commercial pre-twisted, non-jacketed wire. Most likely it got over-stressed at some point. Since that experience, I‚Äôd be extremely cautious about doing anything - like twisting wires with a drill - that could apply enough force to cause such a break. Remember that 22AWG wires can have as few as 7 strands!

I crossed out my suggestion as using the drill method is also more likely to be done by newer students and likely over twisted or done on a short piece. When I do it, I usually have one side in a vice and the other in a drill, and make at least a 15 ft section at a time, spinning the drill slowly and applying even tension, allowing the drill to move forward as the length shortens up. We also use high quality wire with a mid range strand count (19/34).

That being said, I‚Äôm definitely going to look into making a braiding machine as it would be nice to have for low level power wires too.
